title: Logan Paul's new The Maverick trailer addresses suicide forest video
text:
Logan Paul isn’t shying away about addressing the international backlash he had to his suicide forest video in the new trailer for upcoming documentary, The Maverick.

The film, which honours Logan’s recently deceased pet parrot through its title, is due to be released on 2 November.

The trailer starts with Logan’s brother Jake describing how they both got into filming videos.

‘There was really nothing to do in Ohio,’ he said. ‘We were always bored and trying to find fun little things to do.’

Logan Paul as a teenager in trailer for new documentary, The Maverick (Picture: Logan Paul/YouTube)

The boys’ mum Pamela then chimes in: ‘I remember them fooling around with the camera [but] I didn’t really think a whole lot about it.’

It dramatically cuts to sound bites of newsreaders and commentators discussing the backlash to Logan’s now infamous YouTube video where he goes into a Japanese forest and finds a dead body.

The trailer also shows footage of Logan interacting with fellow YouTuber KSI, ahead of their upcoming rematch fight on 9 November.

It ends with the question: ‘Is this a fluff piece to make people feel better about Logan Paul?’

Logan Paul is no stranger to controversy.

Earlier this year, the young YouTube star sparked backlash when he claimed he was going to ‘go gay’ in the month of March.

Critics argued people can’t just switch their sexuality and he later apologised.

He then came under fire for comments he made in a diss to KSI about abortion last month.

Logan Paul features KSI in new trailer for The Maverick (Picture: Michael Tran/Getty Images)

Logan said during the pre-fight press conference in East London: ‘Y’all may not know it but JJ’s on his fifth abortion. His fifth. That’s five babies dead. And I think I might return the favour. And I might kill you.’

‘I might end you. I’mma light you on fire, bro,’ he added.

Logan later stood by his diss but claimed he was pro-choice.

While these later controversies aren’t mentioned in this latest trailer, we’ll have to wait and see if The Maverick really *is* just a ‘puff piece’ to make people feel sorry for Logan.
